page.title: 05LT. GADDESDEN SCHOOL.
page.content: On the 18 May 1854 John Worrall was appointed schoolmaster by Lord Brownlow and on 15 June 1854 he opened a school in the large room at the Bridgewater Arms Inn.When the inn was in use the pupils had to climb into the schoolroom through a window.On the 5 June 1858 the new schoolroom was opened.A.J. Williams is present Head. Today there are three classrooms and a newer block with staff room and stock cupboards.Across the playground lies the hall.There are Padder Tennis courts and netball court.The Orchard has the High Jump sector and to the north are several climbing frames. Several social occasions are held each year including a Bazaar.The choir sings in Hemel Pavilion.The school runs a church service three times a term.At eleven, pupils leave usually to a comprehensive School in Hemel.
